posts.author: Mirnaia
posts.content:
(For a Zen Archer, I'd use both monk and rogue, but only as skill dump levels and for the automatic goodies you get at level 1 (like Demolition Man), because you want to go all out Wis, instead of Dex or Str.)

F/R/C - it's like a "mundane" shadow priest, a lovely combination, but I agree with Grimnir, it's best suited for melee. If you want heavy armour, it's Str time. You'll eventually want at least 19 Wis, and that makes Cha unviable. High Cha would mean being stuck with low Str and Dex (8 Dex to cap to 12 with Cat, and 8 Str to set to 18 with DP), and while you'd have many Divine might&shield uses, you'd be stuck with low AB (a cleric with AB problems :) ) and fighter-like sword&board AC, which isn't terrible but isn't awesome either, but at least you could boost that high with divine shield. Bottom line, whenever you build something with cleric, there is always something better to spend your ability points on than charisma, unfortunately.

That said, if you're struggling, cleric is best when front-loaded, rushing for Cleric 12 (and eventually at least 15) asap, with no or very few multiclass levels taken before that. EDIT: it's a bijection - when front-loaded, cleric is THE best* :)

*but sorcerers are even better, however, this has nothing to do with your questions
